name: Transition Token Consistency
description: Transition tokens define standard animation timings for interactive states. Hardcoded transition values should use tokens to ensure consistent motion across the design system.

--ks-transition-hover.role: Hover state transitions — color changes, opacity shifts on mouse enter/leave
--ks-transition-hover.rationale: Standard hover timing ensures consistent feel across all interactive elements

--ks-transition-collapse.role: Expand/collapse transitions — accordion, FAQ, content reveal
--ks-transition-collapse.rationale: Collapse timing is tuned for content height changes

--ks-transition-fade.role: Fade in/out transitions — modal appear/disappear, overlay, tooltip
--ks-transition-fade.rationale: Fade timing is tuned for opacity transitions

--ks-transition-toggle.role: Toggle transitions — nav toggle, switch, checkbox animation
--ks-transition-toggle.rationale: Toggle timing is tuned for binary state changes

rule: Hardcoded transition values (e.g., 'transition: 0.3s ease') should use transition tokens. This ensures consistent motion design and allows global timing adjustments.
